intro: Geraniospermum exstipulatum, commonly known as the narrow-leaf geraniospermum, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae, which includes plants known for their showy flowers and often succulent foliage. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and clusters of small, pink or white flowers. It thrives in arid or semi-arid conditions, making it well-suited for xerophytic environments. Its botanical features make it a unique addition to succulent gardens and arid landscapes.
